710061f-c.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 4th Street (left, and upon which appears a view from Horatio to 13th Street), showing in the background the New York Port Authority Building and the County Trust Co. Building on opposite sides of this thoroughfare. View No. 2 emphasizes the latter and is in a north eastward direction.

A pecularity of the low foreground structures is that those to the left of the bend bear Nos. 1 and 3 Horatio Street, extending to 4th Street and those to the right, bear No's 51 to 63 Eighth Avenue, proceeding to 13th Street.
July 31, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

(3)
A view limited to the foreground of View 2, showing solely that irregular triangular block between Horatio and W. 13th Streets. At the left is the termination of West 4th Street.
January 22, 1929
P.L. Sperr

710926f-a.text:
4th Street, east side, from Jane to 12th Streets, inclusive, seen from Eighth Avenue and 4th Streets.
The house on the S.E. corner of Jane Street, which used to be wooden with a stone front, has been rebuilt since 1930.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

720680f-a.text:
31, 29, 27, 25-21, 19 Jane Street, north side, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of 4th (formerly Asylum) Street. No. 27 is a frame house.
March 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

720678f-a.text:
Jane Street, east from Eighth Avenue.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

710919f-a.text: 328-330 West 4th Street at S.W. corner of Jane Street, showing Eighth Avenue where the N.W. corner would otherwise have been. 328 is the little one-story house adjoining the corner. March 16, 1933. P.L. Sperr.

710052f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, at Jane Street and north to Horatio Street.
March 10, 1933.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

710059f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, south from Jane Street to Abingdon Square. On the right is the west frontage that extends to W. 12th Street. Upon the latter was erected (1931) the modern 20-story apartment house, No. 299 W. 12th Street. View 2 is limited to this block and its new structure. On the right is south side of Jane Street extending westward to Hudson Street.
May 30, 1929
March 9, 1933
P. L. Sperr

720679f-a.text:
30 to 2 Jane Street, south side, from east of 4th Street and Eighth Avenue to and including Greenwich Avenue, and showing 102-98 Greenwich Avenue.
July 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

Nos. 16 and 18 (the 2 five-story tenements adjoining the garage) (No. 10-14) after an ownership of 60 years by the Edward Brown Estate have been sold and will be extensively altered according to the New York Times of April 12, 1938.
